citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
Two Veterinary Medical Officers arrived at the facility on 18 July, 2025 at 10:50 AM, called the licensee and left a
voicemail as an authorized facility representative approached the gate. The facility representative came to the vehicle and
acknowledged that this site had been sold last fall, but that the licensee was still living on the property. The inspector
informed the facility representative that as the AWA license was still active and associated with this site, we planned to
complete an unannounced inspection. The facility representative replied that since they no longer had a CA Department
of Fish Wildlife permit there was no exhibition and no covered animals at the facility, so no inspection was needed. The
inspectors explained that as the AWA license was still active, this was a routine unannounced inspection and asked "Are
you refusing inspection?" and facility representative said "yes, I am refusing inspection", but then stepped away to consult
legal representation. The facility representative returned to the vehicle and reiterated that she was refusing entry to the
facility and inspection.
An exit interview confirming that the facility representative was refusing inspection was conducted.
Additional Inspectors:
Gustavo Soberano, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.126(a)  Critical
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
Two Veterinary Medical Officers arrived at the facility on 18 July, 2025 at 10:50 AM, called the licensee and left a 
voicemail as an authorized facility representative approached the gate. The facility representative came to the vehicle and 
acknowledged that this site had been sold last fall, but that the licensee was still living on the property. The inspector 
informed the facility representative that as the AWA license was still active and associated with this site, we planned to 
complete an unannounced inspection. The facility representative replied that since they no longer had a CA Department 
of Fish Wildlife permit there was no exhibition and no covered animals at the facility, so no inspection was needed. The 
inspectors explained that as the AWA license was still active, this was a routine unannounced inspection and asked "Are 
you refusing inspection?" and facility representative said "yes, I am refusing inspection", but then stepped away to consult 
legal representation. The facility representative returned to the vehicle and reiterated that she was refusing entry to the 
facility and inspection. 
 
An exit interview confirming that the facility representative was refusing inspection was conducted. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Gustavo Soberano, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
